Late Night Changes to Service

Beginning Monday, June 19, 2017

Due to an ongoing track improvement project, the following adjustments to late night service will take effect starting Monday, June 19th. This construction is expected to last 18 weeks.

  • Weekday service will terminate at Temple University Station for trains #466 (departing terminals at 9:07 p.m. - Alternate Option: Lansdale/Doylestown #594, departing Suburban at 9:50 p.m., with stops at Melrose, Elkins Park Stations), #470 (departing terminals at 10:07 p.m. - Alternate Option, Warminster #472, departing Suburban at 11:05 p.m.), and #474 (departing terminals at 11:07 p.m. - Alternate Option: Lansdale/Doylestown #596, departing Suburban at 11:35 p.m., with stops at Elkins, Melrose Park Stations)

  • Weekday Train #475 (departing Glenside at 10:23 p.m.) will be CANCELED, however, this train will still operate from Temple University (departing at 10:44 p.m.) with service to airport terminals. As an alternate for service from Glenside, customers should take Train #473 (departing Glenside at 9:41 p.m.) or Train #477 (departing Glenside at 10:51 p.m.)

  • Saturday & Sunday Train #476 (departing terminals at 11:37 p.m.) service will terminate at Temple University Station (Alternate Option: Glenside #478, departing Suburban at 12:35 a.m.)

Opposite Side Boarding at Melrose & Elkins Park Stations: 9:30 p.m. - End of Service

While this work takes place, ALL trains will board from the INBOUND (toward Center City) platform at Melrose and Elkins Park Stations. Please listen for station announcements for any additional changes to service or boarding locations.

For a complete list of the adjustments to service, please visit the late night service page.

Wyndmoor Station Improvement Project | Temporary Adjustment to Station Parking

Beginning Monday, June 26 - Friday, September 8, 2017

Due to construction, the following adjustments to parking will take effect beginning Monday, June 26th:

  • Fencing and dumpsters will be installed in the Inbound and Outbound Parking Lots. As an alternate, customers should park in the additional spaces along the driveway, south of the station via Mermaid Ln.

  • Fencing will be installed along the Outbound Parking Lot sidewalk. During construction, this sidewalk will be closed.

  • The station driveway will ONLY be for one-way traffic entering the station. Customers must exit the station via Willow Grove Ave.


Please contact Parking Operations at 215-580-3400 with any questions.

Late Night Changes to Weekday and Saturday & Sunday Service

Effective Monday, June 19, 2017

Due to an ongoing track improvement project, adjustments to late night service will take effect starting Monday, June 19th for Regional Rail trains departing after 9:00 p.m. on the following lines:

Airport, Lansdale/Doylestown, Media/Elwyn, Warminster, and West Trenton

Customers should visit the Late Night service page for a list of the changes and additional service information.

  • Weekday Train #591 (departing Doylestown at 11:07 p.m.) will depart 7 minutes LATER
  • Weekday Train #596 (Departing Suburban Station at 11:20 p.m.) will depart 15 minutes LATER at 11:35 p.m.

Opposite Side Boarding at Melrose & Elkins Park Stations: 9:30 p.m. - End of Service

While this work takes place, ALL trains will board from the INBOUND (toward Center City) platform at Melrose and Elkins Park Stations. Please listen for station announcements for any additional changes to service or boarding locations.

For a complete list of the adjustments to service, please visit the late night service page.

Dates Noted Below

All trains board from the EASTBOUND (toward Frankford
Transportation Center) platform during the dates noted below:

Saturday, August 5 at 4:30 a.m. and continuing through the end of service, Sunday, August 6, 2017

All trains board from the WESTBOUND (toward
69th St. Transportation Center) platform during the dates noted below:

Saturdays at 4:30 a.m. and continuing through the End of Service Sundays, August 12-13, 19-20 & 26-27, 2017

Boarding locations are subject to change. Please listen for station announcements for any additional changes to boarding locations.

Arrott Transportation Center: Temporary Closure of Stairs & Station Escalator, Relocation of Fare Line & Opposite Side Boarding

Service changes & dates noted below:

Due to the improvement project at Arrott Transportation Center, the following impacts to the station will take effect starting Monday, July 31st:

STAIRWAY & ESCALATOR CLOSURE: Customers should use the temporary staircase located across Arrott St.

RELOCATION OF FARE LINE: Customers should use the temporary fare line located on the Westbound side of the station, south of the existing stairway at street level.

Alternate accessibility options during construction:

As an alternate to the temporary stairway, customers should take Bus Routes 3 or 5 for service to Frankford Transportation Center or Church Station.

Please continue to check System Status for updates or changes to service.

Opposite Side Boarding

Nightly, Monday - Friday, August 14-18, 21-25 & 28- Sep. 1, 2017

ALL trains will board from the EASTBOUND (toward Frankford Transportation Center) platform at Arrott Transportation Center and Church Station beginning at 8:15 p.m. and continuing until the end of the service day.

Until Further Notice

Due to an improvement project, the parking lot at Matsonford Station has temporarily closed.

As an alternate, customers should use the parking lot at Gulph Mills Station.

Exton Station - Removal of Temporary Platform on Outbound Side

As of Monday, August 21, 2017

The temporary overflow platform currently in place on the outbound side will be removed on Monday, August 21st. Customers should listen for announcements from train conductors on where to board trains as they arrive.

OUTBOUND (toward Thorndale) High-Level Platform Temporarily Out of Service: Radnor, Wayne, Strafford, and Berwyn Stations

Monday - Friday, 9:00 a.m. - 2:00 p.m.: Beginning Monday, August 14 and continuing through the End of September 2017

Due to Amtrak maintenance, the OUTBOUND high-level platform at Radnor, Wayne, Strafford, and Berwyn Stations will be out of service during the dates and times noted above.

Alternate Accessible Service Options:

Customers traveling toward Thorndale and requiring high-level boarding/de-boarding at one of the stations above should refer to signage posted at stations for alternate service options.

Customers traveling from Center City Stations toward Thorndale should exit the train at Overbrook Station to meet a CCT vehicle for continued service. Customers must notify the conductor of their travel plans.

Customers should still use the Inbound high-level platform for service to Center City.

Customer Parking Notice | Paoli Station

Changes Beginning Monday, July 24, 2017

Paoli Accessibility Project: Tredyffrin Township, Chester County, PA

Daily parking spaces identified by the red box in the map below will be closed beginning Monday, July 24th.

Replacement daily parking spaces are available in the Permit Lot across North Valley Rd. and the tracks, noted by the green box on the map.

ADA parking spaces next to the red box on the map will still be available.

To learn more about the Paoli Accessibility Project or other Rebuilding the System projects, visit www.septa.org/rebuilding

Service Detours

Until Further Notice

Due to ramp construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows:

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Route 15 Detour Map | PDF

Service will operate around the construction with detours stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

Route 43 Bus To Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour.

The construction is expected to last for approximately 2 years and Routes 15 and 43 service will be detoured during this time

advisory_message:
61st & Pine Bus Loop Improvement Project

Temporary Relocation of Route 42 Service During Construction

The customer pick-up and drop off location for the Route 42 will temporarily move to the outside of the Loop.

SEPTA will be improving customer accessibility and operational safety. At the completion of this project, the 61st and Pine Bus Loop will be fully ADA compliant, and will offer new rider travel features including an open-air
customer waiting shelter, trash cans, and bike racks, new energy efficient lighting, new signage, security enhancements, and site landscaping.

Learn more about this project on the Rebuilding the System website.

Chestnut Bridge Weight Restrictions

Until Further Notice

Until Further Notice

During the detour, Route 113 will operate via Bullens Lane, Chester Pike & Morton Avenue

For travel to Widener University, customers should use stop on Morton Avenue at Melrose

Track Reconstruction Project | Girard Ave.: Buses Replace ALL Trolleys

Beginning Sunday, June 18th and continuing through Sunday, September 3, 2017

UPDATE: Trolleys will return to service beginning Sunday, September 3, 2017, effective with the Fall Transit schedule change.

SEPTA forces will excavate, renew, and pave approximately 4,100 feet of the Eastbound and Westbound tracks along Girard Ave. between Broad St. and Corinthian Ave. and the Girard Ave. Bridge, between 33rd and 34th Sts.

Customer Information:

Buses will board at or near Route 15 Trolley stations. Please look for posted signage for boarding information

Vehicular parking will not be permitted in the construction zone.

Access to area businesses will be available at all times during construction.

Here's What's Happening During this Project:

Install new and improved track components for a smoother, quieter ride

Install new concrete and asphalt paving

Renew track originally built in the 1950s

Route 15 Trolley service is expected to resume Monday, September 18, 2017. Please check System Status or follow @SEPTA_TRL_15 for the latest service information.

Until Further Notice

Service towards Richmond & Westmoreland St.

From Aramingo Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Thompson Street towards Allegheny Ave.

From Allegheny Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Belgrade St. towards Aramingo Ave.

61st & Pine Bus Loop Improvement Project

Temporary Relocation of Route 42 Service During Construction

The customer pick-up and drop off location for the Route 42 will temporarily move to the outside of the Loop.

customer waiting shelter, trash cans, and bike racks, new energy efficient lighting, new signage, security enhancements, and site landscaping.

advisory_message:
Track Reconstruction Project | Girard Ave.: Buses Replace ALL Trolleys

Beginning Sunday, June 18th and continuing through Sunday, September 3, 2017

UPDATE: Trolleys will return to service beginning Sunday, September 3, 2017, effective with the Fall Transit schedule change.

SEPTA forces will excavate, renew, and pave approximately 4,100 feet of the Eastbound and Westbound tracks along Girard Ave. between Broad St. and Corinthian Ave. and the Girard Ave. Bridge, between 33rd and 34th Sts.

Customer Information:

Buses will board at or near Route 15 Trolley stations. Please look for posted signage for boarding information

Vehicular parking will not be permitted in the construction zone.

Access to area businesses will be available at all times during construction.

Here's What's Happening During this Project:

Install new and improved track components for a smoother, quieter ride

Install new concrete and asphalt paving

Renew track originally built in the 1950s

Route 15 Trolley service is expected to resume Monday, September 18, 2017. Please check System Status or follow @SEPTA_TRL_15 for the latest service information.

I-95 Reconstruction Program Service Detours

Until Further Notice

Due to ongoing construction taking place as part of the PennDOT I-95 reconstruction program, the Route 15 bus shuttle and Route 43 service will operate on a detour route as follows. Please refer to the notice above for the June 18, 2017 construction along Girard Ave.

Route 15 Shuttle Bus To Richmond & Westmoreland/63rd & Girard

Service will operate around the construction with detour stops on Aramingo Ave. at York & Cumberland Sts.

Richmond St. Closure

Richmond St. is closed due to construction. Shuttle buses will detour as follows:

Service towards Richmond & Westmoreland St.

From Aramingo Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Thompson Street towards Allegheny Ave.

Service towards 63rd & Girard Ave.

From Allegheny Ave., shuttle buses will turn onto Belgrade St. towards Aramingo Ave.

Click here to view the detour map

Route 43 Bus to Richmond & Cumberland/50th & Parkside Loop

Route 43 Detour Map | PDF

Service going towards Parkside Loop will operate around the construction with detour stops on Huntingdon St. at Richmond, Edgemont, & Thompson Sts. and on Aramingo Ave. at Cumberland St., York St., & Delaware & Columbia Aves.

Service on Richmond St. between Cumberland & Beach Sts. and Beach St. to Delaware Ave. will be discontinued during this detour

The construction is expected to last for approximately two years. Routes 15 and 43 will be detoured during this time
